storyInfo: The return of the food carts does little to stem the spread of mayhem. Culann learns the truth before Loughshinny and Nemos find him, and makes the decision to destroy the statue in the middle of the square.

attributes.content: Ouch!
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: The hell's wrong with you, Theo? You have eyes, use them!
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: S-Sorry, Mr. Rory, I was just hoping to try my luck over at Lagran Street, see if I could get some potatoes—
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Get lost!
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: Sorry...
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Look out! The burdenbeast's panicking! Out of the way!
attributes.name: Coachman's Voice

attributes.content: Stupid coachman! You nearly ran me over! Get back here!
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: That dung-for-brains ran off, just like that?!
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: Mr. Rory, I...
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Hah, look who DID get run over! Serves you right.
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: You're not going anywhere now! Let's go see the Dublinn folks. Maybe they'll give me potatoes for handing over a traitor—
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: Better stick to the back streets. Can't have someone else taking my spy...
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: The man grabs the boy's collar and drags him into a small, empty alley. The boy groans in anguish.
Weird. Did I forget the way?
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: Gimme back my potatoes! Go and buy your own! They still have some at the shop!
attributes.name: Voices in the Distance

attributes.content: Give them back!
attributes.name: Voices in the Distance

attributes.content: They still have potatoes?!
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: The man glances towards the voices, then at the broken body of the boy whose arm he is still grabbing.
He's dying. Would the Dublinners even give me anything for a dying kid? Could they even get anything out of him?
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: ...It's your lucky day, traitor.
attributes.name: Brooding Resident

attributes.content: The man shakes off the boy's hand, which had been grabbing his sleeve, and walks off briskly towards the voices.
My leg... it hurts...
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: I can't stand...
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Mrs. Emma...
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Wh-Who's there? Who's calling my name?
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: I-I did as you asked! Just leave me alone—
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: ...Emma!
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: Theo? What happened?
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: I got hit by a carriage, then left behind here.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: I'm not a Victorian spy, Mrs. Emma... Please, help me... take me to Mr. Culann...
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: A Victorian... spy?
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Ah... it's all happening so fast...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: It hurts so much...
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: I know the Victorians did bad things. Nobody likes me, nobody listens to me, nobody wants to get close to me.
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: But could you at least... find Mr. Culann... it hurts... it's so cold...
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: When I grow up... I'll find the Victorians and take revenge... for Mr. Niels...
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: (Takes a deep breath)
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Maybe I'd have helped you, Theo, if Niels was the only one who died.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Mrs... Emma?
attributes.name: Theo

attributes.content: You know that Niels died in the war, but even more people died without ever seeing the battlefield.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: You Victorians blocked off the supply routes. You still are. So many people starved. Including me, including...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Including the child Niels left behind... the child inside me.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: He starved to death because of you Victorians.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Find someone else to get Culann for you. They're all good people, unlike me...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: ...Very good people.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Emma. How could you do that to him, Emma...?
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: What could have changed you so much?
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: I'm not defending her, Culann, but she wasn't the only one there that day.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: No, she wasn't...
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Sorry, shouldn't have said that.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: No, you're absolutely right.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: You wanted to take Theo with you, didn't you? What did you see?
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: He was being bullied. And I'm not talkin' squabbles between kids... by adults.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I intervened the first time I saw it. I thought... I thought it wouldn't happen again.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: But it did. A lot.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I had a bad feeling that he didn't belong here, that there was no place for him in Na Saoirsí. But I never thought...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I understand. You should go.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Culann?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I said I understand.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I SAID I UNDERSTAND! NOW GO! GET OUT! LEAVE ME—
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: ...Leave me be for a while. Please.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: The blacksmith stands silent in the room. All is quiet save for the crackling of the fire.
Theo, I...
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Too many things have passed him by, too many things he could not understand. He no longer has the strength to find out why, to separate cause from effect.
The only thing he knows is that he never achieved anything.
What kind of hero am I?!
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Yeah. What kind of hero are you?
The blacksmith looks around him. There is no one else in the smithy, save the empty eye sockets of the dragon statue, now glaring at him accusingly.
What kind of hero are you?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: What... what kind of hero am I?
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: What kind of hero would leave a child to the mercy of abuse and ill-will?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: What kind of hero would allow food to be smuggled out of the city under his very nose, until there is nothing left. All while doing nothing more than handing out a few shriveled potatoes to his neighbors?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: What kind of hero would shut himself in his smithy while the city descends into bedlam, all to satisfy his own pathetic vanity by etching his name into a pedestal?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: No!
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: I-It's not out of vanity. All I wanted was to use the title of 'hero' to... to...
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: 'To bring happiness to our countrymen who lost everything in the war,' as you told Nemos?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: Like now?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: Like... now?
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: The weak you swore to protect are dead and gone.
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: The justice you swore to uphold has fallen into darkness.
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: The people you swore to bring happiness to... Emma and Rory... are they even your people anymore?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: Or are they the dead, living in the past?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: The dead... living in the past?
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Your heart still dreams of the future, vain as it is. But them? They are the walking dead, stuck in the past.
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: Who is it you are calling your countrymen? The wretch who spends his days brandishing an antique sword he salvaged from the flames?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: The smuggler who let an innocent child die because she miscarried her own?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: 'Townsfolk' who no longer know anything but hate in the face of change?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: Go on, go out and find someone, anyone. Ask them what their plan for the future is. What do you think the answer will be?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: The blacksmith's hammer falls to the ground with a loud crash.
He glares at the dragon's head.
No, no...
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: It's you who's trapping them in the past...
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: I collected the plates and bowls my people used day to day, lit the fuel they relied on for warmth and light, just to feed you... you...
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: You monster.
attributes.name: Culann
Culann
attributes.content: I don't know about the food. But the metal and the fuel...

attributes.name: Culann
attributes.content: It was me. I fed you those pots and pans, I put the people's livelihoods into your mouth with my own hands, all so that you could grow and grow...
You've devoured everything in my life, then you devoured Theo himself...
attributes.name: Culann
Culann
attributes.content: Theo... Theo...

attributes.name: Culann
attributes.content: It was me, I nurtured the monster that took your life!
Soon it will stand in the square on Samhain, spread its wings, and turn everyone in the city into the dead, those who can only live in the past...
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: You're right, monster. I'm no hero.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: I'm a fraud. A vain, pathetic fraud. Once, I fooled others; now, the only one I'm fooling is myself.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: But they need me.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: They need you?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: They need a hero to wake them up, to tell them that the war is over, that what really matters is what lies ahead. The future. Tomorrow.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: And you think you're the one?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: I'm the one.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: The blacksmith walks away from the forge with resolute steps. He takes the thickest metal chain he can find and walks back to the dragon, its empty eyes still fixated upon him.
Come with me.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Where to?
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: To the square.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: It's not Samhain yet.
attributes.name: Dragon

attributes.content: I can wait no more. I will not wait for your ominous prophecies to come true.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: Come with me...
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: I will dismantle you...
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: And return our lives to the people.
attributes.name: Culann

attributes.content: The dragon does not move. In the eyes of the blacksmith, however, he sees the dragon bow its head, perhaps mockingly, perhaps invitingly.
Reed, Nemos, I'm back. Culann's in a real bad place right now. You should go see him.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: How about on your end? What's going on in the city?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: People are still looking for spies... Victorian spies.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Are they off their rockers? Taran or Victorian, we're all human. We gonna keep fighting to the death like this, when the war's already over?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Tell them, Nemos. Tell 'em that Dublinn made 'em go hungry, and was punished by the Red Dragon. The food's now—
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Do not mention the word Dublinn ever again, Brigid. The Leader's orders.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I... only overheard whispers about the food at the victory party. No evidence, no trial.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I don't even know how it got back.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Besides—news about all those missing people hasn't spread at all... How am I supposed to explain it?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: If they can't be reasoned with, we'll do this the hard way.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: When I came back, I told myself I would never be her shadow again.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: But if the true Leader is refusing to show her face and take responsibility, then I must step up, if only to calm the people.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: What about Culann? Everyone knows him as a hero. Things would be much simpler if he's willing to help.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: He should still be at his smithy. I'll lead the way.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: As for you, Brigid, you should leave the city as soon as possible.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Well... if we and Culann both fail, then the people will...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I see. They don't much like me here, so I'd just get in the way, is that it?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Brigid, that's not what I meant, but—
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: But it's true.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Don't worry, I'll try my luck in the Dark Woods. Sixth time's the charm.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Culann!
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Culann...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Is he not in?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: He...
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: What the...?!
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: They are both rendered speechless.
The door of the smithy...
No, the entire front wall of the smithy is gone.
The wall, which was supposed to stay up until the statue was finished, is now a pile of rubble. Visible through it is a long trail leading to the square.
Along with drag marks so broad they span almost the entire breadth of the road.
